data.title: Quick bite
data.text: If five guys burgers had a sibling that made mini burgers, it would be Sliders. The sliders and fries were made fresh and it took relatively no time to complete my order. It was a little bit pricey, but I soon forgot about that as I ate my sliders. I went on a Friday and the two ladies there were awesome.

data.title: Good little burger joint
data.text: We saw this place walking around downtown and tried it. It was amazingly good burgers, however, they are a bit pricey for such small burgers.

data.title: Great Little Dive Burger Joint!
data.text: Yes, this place is a dive! Don't come here if you're expecting gourmet burgers.  This is a fun place to visit after a night at the bars/clubs.  It's small and intimate and they cook the burgers right in-front of you. Good greasy sliders and fries! If you're hungry try a bag of burgers ;-).

data.title: Hole in the wall, stand outside on the sidwalk and eat your greasy sliders and fries!
data.text:
Good sliders, much better than fast food!
A takeout place where nobody takes the food home!
The food is hot a greasy and will be cold and unappetizing before you could get it home.
But standing on a street corner in downtown Springfield eating out of a brown paper bag?
Priceless!
.
College kids fuel up here and stumble on to the next bar!

data.title: A Perfect, Gritty Downtown Experience
data.text:
Whisler's is not a place you go to eat an artistic burger with classy fries and a beverage housed in a fancy cup. It's not a place you go to sit with your family and and smile at all the other sweet, loving families enjoying tasty family favorites all around you. Whisler's is a place you go to get a damn good burger and fries dirt cheap. The bag is greasy, the burgers are unhealthy, and it's some of the best stuff you can get downtown. 

You can practically fill a bag with burgers for like 8 dollars. Good burgers too. The fries share in this deliciousness and are equally cheap. You'll find very limited seating on the main level, but up a somewhat dangerous flight of stairs you'll find ample seating and an awkward bathroom. It makes for a good view of downtown from up above, and you get to share in the unholy greasiness with those around you. 

This is an experience not to be missed in Springfield.

data.title: Greasy and delicious!
data.text:
This is a cool little hole in the wall place that serves excellent sliders with a hometown atmosphere.  They have different specials each night, and you can order a variety of burgers with various toppings.  Tonight I went with the classic cheeseburger, and I wasn't let down.  For a slider that just stuck with the basic bun, burger and toppings, Whistlers definitely knows there is no need to mess with what's not broken.  I will definitely be coming back to try more of the specialty burgers that they offered on the menu.  I mean, come on - who doesn't want to bring home a brown bag stuffed with delicious sliders?

Although the atmosphere fits a greasy, old fashion joint, there is limited seating - not a place I would recommend to have a sit down meal.

data.title: Greasy Burger Joint
data.text: Greasy ol' hole in the wall. But good prices on "bags" (usually 5 or 6) burgers, but don't order the fries, they are the cheapest frozen/bagged fries you can get anywhere....they are worse than school cafeteria bad. Great place to go to when looking for an affordable place...especially if you're feeding many mouths (or are drunk or hungover)

data.title: First time lunch
data.text: This is located in downtown Springfield. We went for lunch. We got the Tuesday special and split it. We could have ate more! It was delicious. The fries were very tasty as well. When you walk in the door , there appears to be no place to eat but there is a dining area upstairs and a couple of tables outside on the sidewalk.

data.title: Great after bar food
data.text:
If your have been partying downtown, Whisler's is good greasy food to soak up the booze while you sober up before heading home. 
They have pretty honest sliders that you can't go wrong with.

data.title: Good sliders!
data.text: My family enjoys eating here when we are downtown.  The specials help us make up our minds on what to eat most times.  We will be back.

data.title: Good Sliders but $$ for what you get
data.text: What can I say, This place has great slider burgers. BUT they are a little pricey. The fries here are greasy and kind of remind me I am going to have a heart attack if I eat them. But hey, who is thinking they are eating healthy when going to a burger joint? :)

data.title: Good food - wide variety on menu
data.text: This pub type restaurant had a very wide variety of foods on its menu.  We were there at 3:00 p.m. and could see both the lunch and dinner menus.  The Rueben was great.

data.title: Late night grub
data.text: Greasy. Hot.  Small. Cheap. Late night. Drunk food. Classic. Can be a little slow but if you've been drinking and want some grub- come here then go Hurts for dessert :-)

data.title: Greesey Goodness!!
data.text: This is a classic greasy burger place and it is CHEAP! Grab about 3 of their cheese burgers and eat them while you are walking around the downtown area.

data.title: Are you drunk downtown? I have good news...
data.text: Whistler's is just around the corner!!! Perfectly situated "across the street" from every bar down town, you can go in and get a burger for almost nothing - and all night long! So as you stumble out of your bar, you can just stumble right through! Jewish? Vegetarian? No worries! They've got you covered. This place was much needed and pretty much an instant success when they opened.

data.title: Mom & Pop Knew How To Do It
data.text:
This place has great sliders and are absolutely most popular after drinking - late night on weekends. 

However, most places in town don't have options like these when they're so small.  Turkey Burgers, a vegetarian option, and more menu options being added all the time.

Looking for a challenge?  Try one of their named burgers that contain up to 20 patties, bacon, ham, and much more.

data.title: small place
data.text: I was in town on business and walked there with some coworkers who had found it online in a search for nearby places. They said it got 4 of 5 stars. I was disappointed when we got there that it was a small place with just one small table inside and two tables outside on the sidewalk. The burgers were small and on dinner roll type buns. It was ok, but I would have preferred something different.
